intro: Deinostigma cyrtocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Deinostigma cyrtocarpum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
